instructions: This is the public broadcast feed for CloudOS. Push updates to this file to broadcast to all CloudOS users. Messages are fetched via raw.githubusercontent.com.

messages.text: Welcome to the CloudOS Broadcast Network! This feed is hosted on GitHub and fetched live by every CloudOS instance. Post a message locally, export it, and push to this repo to broadcast to everyone.

How it works:
1. Write a message in the Broadcast app
2. Click Export to download feed.json
3. Push feed.json to broadcasts/ in the repo
4. Everyone who clicks 'Fetch Live Feed' sees your message!
Share your apps via CloudStore, chat on Broadcast, play cartridge games in the Arcade. All powered by public GitHub raw URLs. No servers, no accounts, no APIs.
Just built a tiny markdown editor app in CloudOS! Saves to localStorage and exports as .md file. Should I add it to the CloudStore?
Made this little 16x16 sprite in PixelStudio - my first pixel art! It's supposed to be a cat but looks more like a blob with ears lol
Quick question - how do cartridges work exactly? Are they just packaged HTML apps with a specific format?
@jenna_codes Yep! Cartridges are JSON files with html/css/js strings. The Arcade app loads them into an iframe. Check out the cartridges/ folder in the repo for examples.

Anyone else running into performance issues with Three.js scenes in CloudOS? My particle system drops to 15fps when I have >5000 particles. Wondering if it's the iframe overhead or my code is just bad ðŸ˜…
@sarah_webgl Try using InstancedMesh instead of individual meshes - huge perf boost. Also make sure you're using BufferGeometry not Geometry. I got 20k particles running at 60fps with those changes.
why does every OS need a calculator app? genuine question. like when's the last time you opened the calculator app instead of just googling '2+2'
